text:
88 yr female active at baseline. Pt w/ cough X 10 days w/ SOB, DOE,
   "dark" diarrhea, and poor appetite. Per pt's son pt [**Name2 (NI) 8569**] last
   noc. In EW INR 12. Pt w/ large melana in EW. BP stable. HR 90's to low
   100's. Hct 35. SpO2 88% w/ minimal activity on 3L FiO2 via NC. Pt
   required NRB X several hours. Given Vit K 10mg. 1.5L NS, Protonix,
   nebs, FFP X 2 units. Chest CT shows bilateral opacitiy L>R, Head CT
   negative. Given ceftriaxone. Influenza swab pnd.  FiO2 has been weaned
   to 5L via NC. Pt seen by GI. Pt being transferred to MICU for further
   management.
   Anxiety
   Assessment:
   Pt  oriented x3 but with visual hallucinations and agitation. Hr  and
   bp at times elevated with these episodes of agitation. Altered mental
   status may likely be delirium in the setting of gi bleed,poor sleep and
   poor po intake. Ct of head done on admission neg.
   Action:
   Pt
s son [**Name (NI) 1470**] remained at bedside and reoriented and calmed pt. she was
   medicated with 5 mg xyprexa 1 1 with very short term effect and then
   was given 0.5 mg iv ativan for picc line placement. Pt frequently
   reoriented and reassured
   Response:
   Pt continued to be anxious  though this afternoon while on higher
   requirements of fio2 on bipap pt less anxious and sleeping in long
   naps. Pt
s son remains at bedside.
   Hypoxemia
   Assessment:
   According to medical icu team pt
s work of breathing appears worse than
   yesterday. Increased work of breathing on face mask with borderline o2
   sats.  Most likely viral/atypical
   Action:
   Response:
   Plan:
